A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems


Source Code Equivalence Destination Code Comment
home (Home) H (home address)
work (Work) WP (work place)
temp (Temporary) TMP (temporary address)
old (Old / Incorrect) disjoint BAD (bad address) In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

resource.name: FHIR-v3-Address-Use
resource.title: FHIR/v3 Address Use Mapping
resource.description: A mapping between the FHIR and HL7 v3 AddressUse Code systems
resource.purpose: To help implementers map from HL7 v3/CDA to FHIR

target.comment: In the HL7 v3 AD, old is handled by the usablePeriod element, but you have to provide a time, there's no simple equivalent of flagging an address as old

SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna (http://hl7.org/fhir/ConceptMap/103)

Mapping from http://snomed.info/id?fhir_vs to http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icd-10-us

DRAFT (not intended for production usage). Published on 13/06/2012 by HL7, Inc (FHIR project team (example): http://hl7.org/fhir). Creative Commons 0

Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna


Source Code Equivalence Destination Code Comment
263204007 (Fracture of shaft of ulna) narrower S52.209A The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.
narrower S52.209D The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent), fracture type and healing (for subsequent encounter) is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

resource.name: SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM mappings for fracture of ulna
resource.description: Example rule-based mappings between SNOMED CT to ICD-10-CM for fracture of ulna

target.comment: The target mapping to ICD-10-CM is narrower, since additional patient data on the encounter (initial vs. subsequent) and fracture type is required for a valid ICD-10-CM mapping.

ACNE (Tissue, Acne) :(equivalent) 309068002 (Skin lesion sample)
ACNFLD (Fluid, Acne) :(equivalent) 119323008 (Pus specimen) 47002008 (Pustule) HL7 term is a historical term. mapped to Pus
AIRS (Air Sample) :(equivalent) 446302006 (Air sample)

ATTE (Environment, Attest) :unmatched TBD
AUTOC (Environmental, Autoclave Capsule) :unmatched TBD
AUTP (Autopsy) :unmatched This really is not a specimen per se - it is the state of the subject from whom the specimen is collected, so it should be used as a specimen type modifier ONLY!. Often this is indicated with a special medical record number or other notation on the patient. needs to have specimen type (e.g. SPM-4) and source site (SPM.8) and spatial orientation (SPM.9)
BBL (Blood bag) :(equivalent) 119304001 (Blood bag specimen)
BCYST (Cyst, Baker's) :unmatched 32361000 (Popliteal fossa) submitted (PLR155) with parent of 167874004^knee joint synovial fluid (specimen), with specimen source topography 32361000^Popliteal fossa structure (body structure)

BON (Bone) :(equivalent) 430268003 (Specimen from bone)
BOWL (Bowel contents) :unmatched Don't use this term for human samples - use Stool instead. animal would use small intestinal contents, large intestinal contents
BPU (Blood product unit) :(equivalent) 119300005 (Specimen from blood product)
BRN (Burn) :(equivalent) 119367005 (Specimen from burn injury)

CSITE (Catheter Insertion Site) :(equivalent) 258507003 (Swab of line insertion site) 285570007 (Taking of swab) 386144009 (Line insertion site) Prefer to have aspirate of the pus oozing out from cleaned insertion site - if swab is all that can be obtained, then swab after cleaning, otherwise you may get a contaminated specimen and a falsely identified infected central line. Do not just swab the reddened area - that will just collect skin flora

resource.name: Specimen mapping from v2 table 0487 to SNOMED CT

target.comment: HL7 term is a historical term. mapped to Pus

This really is not a specimen per se - it is the state of the subject from whom the specimen is collected, so it should be used as a  specimen type modifier ONLY!. Often this is indicated with a special medical record number or other notation on the patient. needs to have specimen type (e.g. SPM-4) and source site (SPM.8) and spatial orientation (SPM.9)
